docs.lead_paragraph: Morgan Stanley, which has not had much joy in a rough year for Wall Street, had reason to celebrate on Wednesday.

headline.main: Where Lupo the Wolf Goes for Dinner

docs.snippet: From the Palma Boy Social Club to the Isaac Newton Middle School, Harlem's Pleasant Avenue has changed....
docs.abstract: From the Palma Boy Social Club to the Isaac Newton Middle School, Harlem's Pleasant Avenue has changed.

headline.main: Where Lupo the Wolf Goes for Dinner

docs.snippet: From the Palma Boy Social Club to the Isaac Newton Middle School, Harlem's Pleasant Avenue has changed....
docs.abstract: From the Palma Boy Social Club to the Isaac Newton Middle School, Harlem's Pleasant Avenue has changed.
docs.lead_paragraph: On a December night in 2003, at Rao's, the legendary restaurant on Pleasant Avenue in East Harlem, a man nicknamed Louie Lump Lump shot another patron after reportedly taking issue with his disparaging comment about the female singer's rendition of "Don't Rain on My Parade" from "Funny Girl." The incident felt like a tale from a bygone era and garnered a great deal of giddily nostalgic local press. One patron told The Daily News, "I was surprised. Things like that don't happen here." At least not in recent decades.

docs.snippet: What does the president’s relationship with his black valet tell us about his views on black citizenship?...
docs.abstract: What does the president’s relationship with his black valet tell us about his views on black citizenship?

byline.original: By PHILLIP W. MAGNESS and SEBASTIAN PAGE

docs.snippet: What does the president's relationship with his black valet tell us about his views on black citizenship?...
docs.abstract: What does the president's relationship with his black valet tell us about his views on black citizenship?

byline.original: By PHILLIP W. MAGNESS and SEBASTIAN PAGE

docs.lead_paragraph: One day in early 1864, a journalist found Abraham Lincoln busy counting greenbacks. "This, sir, is something out of my usual line," the president told the reporter, "but a president of the United States has a multiplicity of duties not specified in the Constitution or acts of Congress." The money belonged to a porter in the Treasury Department who was in the hospital and so ill from smallpox that he could not even draw his pay. The president had collected the outstanding wages himself and was dividing them into envelopes in accordance with the porter's wishes.

headline.main: Syrian Defector: More Guns, Less Gandhi

docs.snippet: With his slight figure and pensive disposition, Ammar Cheikh Omar seems more like a contemplative philosophy student than a would-be Syrian Rambo. But the 29-year-old defector from the Syrian Army insists it is time for the Syrian opposition to sh...
docs.abstract: With his slight figure and pensive disposition, Ammar Cheikh Omar seems more like a contemplative philosophy student than a would-be Syrian Rambo. But the 29-year-old defector from the Syrian Army insists it is time for the Syrian opposition to shed its passive philosophizing. It is time, he says, to take up arms. He and other young Syrians are fed up with the passive resistance espoused by their opposition leaders. Gandhi's ideology, he says ruefully, is no match for a loaded AK-47. Guns must be met with guns.

But the 29-year-old defector from the Syrian Army insists it is time for the Syrian opposition to shed its passive philosophizing. It is time, he says, to take up arms. He and other young Syrians are fed up with the passive resistance espoused by their opposition leaders. Gandhi's ideology, he says ruefully, is no match for a loaded AK-47. docs.lead_paragraph: With his slight figure and pensive disposition, Ammar Cheikh Omar seems more like a contemplative German philosophy student than a would-be Syrian Rambo. But the 29-year-old defector from the Syrian Army insists it is time for the Syrian opposition to shed its passive philosophizing. It is time, he says, to take up arms.

headline.print_headline: Measuring a Giant’s Stature: Investors Get the Chance To Assess Facebook’s Potential
headline.main: Investors Get the Chance to Assess Facebook's Potential

docs.snippet: If Facebook's initial valuation pushes $100 billion, it would be far bigger than many established American companies, including Amazon, Caterpillar, Kraft Foods, Goldman Sachs and Ford Motor....

docs.abstract: If Facebook's initial valuation pushes $100 billion, it would be far bigger than many established American companies, including Amazon, Caterpillar, Kraft Foods, Goldman Sachs and Ford Motor.

byline.original: By PETER EAVIS and EVELYN M. RUSLI

docs.lead_paragraph: With a huge initial public offering on the runway, Facebook has shown that it pays to have friends. New investors will now have to decide what they are willing to pay to be friends.
